result.execSummary:
The defendant Giovanni S Fields was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AFTER SERVING 5 YEARS.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count 5

superMiscConds.notes: Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both.
Not to reside or be present where firearm are present in any vehicle.

supervisions.notes: Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Provide a DNA sample. 
Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Giovanni S Fields

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Giovanni S Fields in court, in custody.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Giovanni S Fields.  Attorney Michael Jerome Lonski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statement: Brenda F., Ziomaira R. and Iman M.

AS TO COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 13 YEARS, concurrent to count 5, credit for 202 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 8 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT 5: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 13 YEARS, concurrent to count 1, credit for 202 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 8 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS. 


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- Not to reside or be present where firearm are present in any vehicle.

- Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, including the DNA surcharges to be paid from the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 


*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program AFTER SERVING 5 YEARS.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, 
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Giovanni S Fields in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Giovanni S Fields in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNTS 1 and 5.  

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 2,3,4,6,7,8,9,10,11,12, and 13 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 4.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Giovanni S Fields not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for status conference. Defense requests projected guilty plea date. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Giovanni S Fields not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Arguments heard as to defense's bail motion. For reasons stated on the record, Court denies bail motion. Defense requests additional time for review. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Giovanni S Fields in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Giovanni S Fields in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 04, Judge Hanrahan. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense request to be heard as to bail. Case is adjourned to Br. 04.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 033189,
Payable Number: 996612,
Receipt Number: 22RP013197,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Giovanni S Fields not in court, defendant in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with LR or their residence; YGG or or their residence; MR or their residence.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Giovanni S Fields in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Giovanni S Fields in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Giovanni S Fields appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Giovanni S Fields
Current: 2739 N 47th St, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 03-18-2022)
Prior: 3979 South 51st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53220
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
